column4: im running ubuntu feisty, can someone help me switch off ALL desktop effects and disable beryl by default please?
without uninstalling it? System > prefs> desktop effects
yes. when i go to desktop effects it says enable effects, but they are already enabled? and the beryl symbol is in the systray (or whatever linux calls it)
the icon in the systray should have a right click menu option to disable it
and beryl has been discontinued, and merged with compiz
im aware of that but i dont want to upgrade just yet. beryl only offers quit by right click and last time i did this it still loaded on restart. i want everything disabled by defualt.
ah, you'll have to remove it from your session
and check which session you're choosing when you log in. choose gnome
can you walk me through that please? i dont understand most of what you just said
remove beryl from startup, and current session
and save. then when you log in next time. there's an option to choose your session. make sure you're not choosing a session called beryl
removed beryl but effects are still running
then it shouldn't start up again next session :)
